title.narrative: Getting started: Supporting Palestininan entrepreneurs to start their business

description.narrative: Business incubation team and incubation experts Academic institutions including Universities and Colleges in the Gaza strip Students and fresh graduates from Business Administration, Engineering and IT Faculties in local Universities and colleges Potential young and female entrepreneurs and other marginalized groups Existing small and medium sized companies and start-ups Stakeholders of Business development and entrepreneurship support sector and national policy makers

Project outputs: These activities will result in: For outcome 1.1: Output 1.1.1: 3 BTI team members received training on at least 3 professional business incubation modules (as described in Northern partners blank submitted to SPARK) online and by attending training sessions and seminars abroad by December, 2012. Output 1.1.2: Attending at least one visit abroad where the 3 BTI team members have experienced the environment of business incubators and IT parks abroad resulting in signing 2 co-incubation agreements by October, 2012. Output 1.1.3: Adopting a Balanced Score Card (BSC) module for BTI by the end of 2012
For outcome 1.2: Output 1.2.1: The BTI increased its incubational capacity to host at least 14 SMEs in the incubator, creating at least 12 new jobs by September, 2012
For outcome 2.1: Output 2.1.1: Approving and incubating at least 8 new SMEs to start their businesses by October, 2012 Output 2.1.2: Training 100 potential entrepreneurs for 36 hours by professional experts on entrepreneurship, preparing business plans and other financial and marketing subjects by August, 2012
For outcome 3.1: Output 3.1.1: Training about 30 entrepreneurs (incubated SMEs) for 30 hours on professional subjects by July, 2012 Output 3.1.2: Coaching about 14 incubated SME groups for 10 hours each by the end of 2012 Output 3.1.3: Financing at least 3 SMEs via loans and/or shares acquisition Output 3.1.4: Increased knowledge and practice of 6 entrepreneurs from various SMEs after undertaking visits abroad
For outcome 3.2: Output 3.2.1: Increased knowledge and practice of about 14 incubated SME groups and improve their skills to acquire financing and hold partnerships with potential investors resulting in revised business plans and business models for these SMEs
For outcome 3.3: Output 3.3.1: Preparing a draft with detailed recommendations after summarizing the notes and findings from "Business barriers" workshops to be held between BTI team, SMEs, NGO representatives, academic institutions and officials, and delivering the draft for higher authorities for approval and to take the required steps to remove the business barriers from their side
For outcome 4.1: Output 4.1.1: Implementing a one-year Entrepreneurship Development Professional Diploma program with the aim of graduating at least 25 highly skilled entrepreneurs who are able to start their businesses by the first semester of the 2012 academic year. Output 4.1.2: Implementing an elective course for Entrepreneurship Development to be taught at local academic institutions targeting at least 45 senior students from Commerce, Engineering and Information Technology faculties by the first semester of the 2012 academic year

organisation.narrative: Business and Technology Incubator of the Islamic University of Gaza

mailing-address.narrative: Business and Technology Incubator of the Islamic University of Gaza P.O. Box GAZA Palestijns Bezette Gebieden
